intro: Erodium trichomanaefolium, commonly known as the woolly bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a low-growing habit and produces capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. The species is part of the Geraniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
